title: Just because something is true doesn't make it right.

replies.body: Junglers that do nothing hide behind this argument. Yes most players should understand junglers doing things on the other side of the map is fine they can't always gank your lane, but it's particularly frustrating when you get ganked 4+ times and you junglers score is still 0/0/0. Like fucking do something man anything! Gank a lane doesn't even have to be mine! I don't wanna see my leesin or Elise power farming for 6 fucking items.

There is this thing called "objectives" and "counter jungling" that could have someone be 0/0/0 and yet still be doing the right things.

Your problem seems to stem from the fact that you think kills mean everything, when in fact, you can win a game without getting any kills at all. Worry less about the score of other people and worry more about how to play a little safer to avoid dying so much.

Safest way to take dragon is to gank botlane first, safest way to take rift is to gank mid/top and then go for the objective, of course you can sneak these things, but counterjungling isn't a good excuse. I don't care what my jungler is doing as long as they are doing something. Many of them are useless then wonder why team doesn't win 4v5

most people don't even know how to play jungle without going a safe pick like {{champion:19}}  or {{champion:20}} 

unlike every other position, there is no tutorial and no practice.  You either learn through cold, hard experience or you watch a video of someone else doing something and COPY THEM.  In addition to that, the Jungling role changes the most frequently because Riot constantly upsets the balance of things to keep it "interesting"

jungler got so bad recently that the talk of the top lane second support came back...

add to that that if you don't play something meta, a large portion of people will scream their frustrations at you and it makes it very hard to be creative with the role

Counter jungling is overrated in a snowball meta, especially with the jungle being in such a sorry state lately. Snowballing lanes is more important.

That said sometimes you just can't do that. 2 of 3 lanes are pushed and the 3rd is Cait/Janna

And you usually need a personnel advantage to take objectives.

actually counter-jungling is extremely valuable in a snowball meta, it just has to be done correctly. not mindlessly taking random camps
deep vision = laners can play with more knowledge and safety
enemy jg has no camps, they get corralled into a gank on that side or have to abandon it
kill the enemy jg and take the camp? that is a huge xp swing  that makes objectives significantly lower risk.

it becomes a lot harder for them to gank though if they have no gold

it's not optimal, but it can give an edge, or free buffs if you steal theirs

> [{quoted}](name=Silly Neeko,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=pVB6XLPL,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2019-03-25T22:36:52.658+0000)
>
 to avoid dieing so much.


Everything was fine until I saw that and my eyes exploded. It's dying not ''dieing''.
Dunno what you are talking about :^)
I agree, but I have SEEN THINGS, junglers only farming their jungles and NOT getting dragon, herald or contesting barons. Its hard down here in silver man.

>There is this thing called "objectives" and "counter jungling" that could have someone be 0/0/0 and yet still be doing the right things.

I know what you mean. I have seen junglers being flamed by pretty much everyone for no ganks, and it has felt like I was the only one noticing the jungler would hold 3 towers to his name, taking 2 dragons, stalling (ultimately denying) baron, and the only one responsible for any actual objective progress.

If it's a bad thing when the enemy jungler tries to gank a well-warded bot lane, and our own jungler takes top turret while me and the ADC takes a moment of chill under our own turret, then I guess most junglers are guilty as charged.
Lol, imagine counter-jungling these days. With how fast camps spawn, and how much more important it is to get tower plates down, counter-jungling is essentially a waste of time

> [{quoted}](name=FrozenFrostFyre,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=pVB6XLPL,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2019-03-25T22:18:05.882+0000)
>
> Junglers that do nothing hide behind this argument. Yes most players should understand junglers doing things on the other side of the map is fine they can't always gank your lane, but it's particularly frustrating when you get ganked 4+ times and you junglers score is still 0/0/0. Like fucking do something man anything! Gank a lane doesn't even have to be mine! I don't wanna see my leesin or Elise power farming for 6 fucking items.

People need to get KDA out of their heads.

A 0/0/0 jungler may or may not have ganked-there are such things as successful ganks without a kill-forcing someone to blow flash, and/or getting them low enough they have to go b, allowing your team to get ahead. They may have gotten dragon/Herald, counter jungled, etc. Quite frankly when I jungle, I find it annoying when one lane keeps pinging me to help. If you've died 4 times to ganks/your opponent, they're going to be too far ahead for me to do much anyways, unless they try to dive while I'm there. It'd literally be a waste of time to go up there.

As one who plays both top and jungle, I'm telling you-if you're in a bad spot and keep getting ganked, play even more defensive. Give up the turret if you have to. Heck, if it's that bad, try either a lane swap with mid or ganking other lanes/grouping. This sounds strange, but I've lost games when playing as top, because my opponent I was crapping on (I'm 3-0 or 4-0) decides to roam bottom, gets a double, gets dragon, then takes out a tower or two. The match is now even.

I'm not saying there's no such thing as a bad jungler, that they are never to blame, that a 0/0/0 means they're always fine. Rather, I'm trying to impress upon you to look around at what they're doing, not just KDA, since there's so much more to it than that.
*and yet somehow getting outfarmed
^ along with being able to win lane without ganks if they are ganking another lane.

Exactly. I mean yeah, it feels pretty bad when you are winning lane against someone but their jungler turns it around. But the reality is the jungler is every bit your opponent as the enemy laner is. You defeated one opponent but not the other one. It is a 5 vs 5 after all.

Yeah, but you should at LEAST be able to win lane by yourself so the jungler does not have to babysit you after 2 ganks (successful or not). I see people getting absolutely camped out the wazzoo by the jungler, but the laner still dies 1v1 and is still being outfarmed etc.... then blames the jungler for not helping enough to keep the enemy down.

You will never learn how to win lane by yourself unless you learn how to not rely on your jungler. After that, you make their ganks even better by knowing what to do by yourself.

Sadly.... this concept is a lost art.

I always just run on the assumption the enemy jungler plans to camp me, and my jungler never intends to gank.

That way if my jungler *does* gank or the enemy leaves me alone, that's great, but if only the enemy ganks I am not disappointment and am less likely to tilt.

If i am playing a champion like Nasus or Yorick or Mordekaiser, there are times that I will simply tell the jungler "dont bother coming top unless all the other lanes are ahead or unless it is an absolute easy gank and you are in the area." Generally i will win the lane myself even after getting ganked 2 or so times by the enemy jungler (Not all the time, just from my experience quite a bit of the time).

If they listen then generally we get ahead and win the game, if they do not, it tends to end badly overall.

But yes, pretty much the same thing lol, not saying that the jungler would be useless, just wouldnt be ganking my lane.

"Trust no one but yourself" and "always expect the worst" - sad how even basic life advice is a lost art, and even when it has no real consequences in a video game.

But I agree - as a support player, I always assume it's me and the ADC against the world. Up until the 5-10 minute mark anyway, when it's apparently me against our ADC from there on out.

> [{quoted}](name=Silly Neeko,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=pVB6XLPL,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-03-25T21:51:45.855+0000)
>
> ^ along with being able to win lane without ganks if they are ganking another lane.

Uhhhh,ngl, some lanes are just seriously flat out unwinnable without jg assistance. And if you happen to be in one of those, it is 100% your jungler's fault if you say hey, give me some help or I'll get pooped on because of pick order and they refuse
That said it is still possible to play safe and not die while they are helping other lanes

It is true that you may not always be able to win lane..... but generally that is after they out skilled you or you messed up.

No matter how hard of a counter you are to someone, you still can win fairly easy if you play better. Some could be harder matches, and you may end up losing anyways, but there is only 3 ways to actually lose lane unless junglers are involved (and even then)....

1) They out skilled you. This does happen, and it is ok. Try to play better defencively than offensively.

2) You messed up. Also happens, but also ok as long as you play a little safer and try to correct your mistakes.

3) You give up. Generally what happens when there is the mix of the first two with 0 thought of correcting, and is generally what causes flame for the jungler is those that fall under this catagory.

Not saying junglers are saints, but people seem to not realize that omg. There is two brains between the two of you and they are not always doing everything the other wants! 

If the jungler is on the other side of the map and and the top laner pings for help....

 the laner thinks "alright the jungler is going to be running and not getting ANYTHING at all on the way up because i pinged and i think i need help.

The jungler thinks "laner pinged, i am going to need to get some monsters on the way there so that i am not 2 levels behind the enemy, and i may need to buy sime items and heal up before i go."

^there are arguements for both, but honestly i wish that people would play as the role they complain about so that they can see all the things that they already have to deal with.... not for a game or two, but like a week. After that, then people can complain if they feel the need to.
Shirou emiya wants to know your location

I'd pay 100 bucks if just one of my idiot laners could understand basic, fucking, common sense.

"DURRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRR I was at enemy tower and died to gank/roam, Fucking jungler is shit" 

"DUHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH I asked for a gank while my enemies were under tower, JUNGLER IS LAZY POS"

I know that Lol is sorta the joke of video games, but come one, do the people need to be like that too?

Look m8. I'm a high elo player I understand that getting objectives is a priority, but so is KPA. You need to have an impact on the game as a jungler it is as simple as that. Go watch ANY higher elo game and analyse the meta or what jungle priorities are. Junglers who go 0/0/0 are simply failing at their 1 job which is to have a large impact on sololanes tipping the balance in your favor. Getting summs isn't an excuse, because if you get a laner to blow thier summs you should be repeat ganking multiple times for the kill.
WINDWALL/1000 dashes away.

>https://i.imgur.com/UULPCym.png[/img]

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GRWbIoIR04c

https://youtu.be/oCAvBrudkwA?t=418
yup ward hard and well that control ward with give great converge.
